intro: Hermannia latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved hermannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the rainy season. Hermannia latifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky outcrops.
